Home > external > kegg > getModelFromKEGG.m

getModelFromKEGG

PURPOSE

getModelFromKEGG

SYNOPSIS

function [model,KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(keggPath,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral)

DESCRIPTION 

 getModelFromKEGG
   Retrieves information stored in KEGG database and generates a model

   Input:
   keggPath            if keggGenes.mat, keggMets.mat, keggPhylDist.mat or
                       keggRxns.mat are not in the RAVEN/external/kegg
                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database
                       (opt, default 'RAVEN/external/kegg'). If
                       keggModel.mat is present in the same directory, the
                       function reads the data from this file and ignores
                       keggGenes.mat, keggMets.mat and keggRxns.mat
   keepSpontaneous     include reactions labeled as "spontaneous" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepUndefinedStoich include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)

   Output:
   model               a model structure generated from the database. All
                       reactions and the metabolites used in them will be
                       added
   KOModel             a model structure representing the KEGG Orthology
                       ids and their associated genes. The KO ids are
                       saved as reactions

   NOTE: The model output from getModelFromKEGG can be used as template
   for fillGaps. In that case, ensure that the genes and rxnGeneMat fields
   are removed before parsing: model=rmfield(model,'genes'), etc.

   Usage: [model,KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(keggPath,keepSpontaneous,...
    keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral)

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getGenesFromKEGG getGenesFromKEGG
  • getMetsFromKEGG getMetsFromKEGG
  • getRxnsFromKEGG getRxnsFromKEGG
This function is called by:
  • getKEGGModelForOrganism getKEGGModelForOrganism

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function output = isNewestFile(ravenPath)
  • function modTime = getFileTime(fileName)

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function [model,KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(keggPath,keepSpontaneous,...
0002     keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral)
0003 % getModelFromKEGG
0004 %   Retrieves information stored in KEGG database and generates a model
0005 %
0006 %   Input:
0007 %   keggPath            if keggGenes.mat, keggMets.mat, keggPhylDist.mat or
0008 %                       keggRxns.mat are not in the RAVEN/external/kegg
0009 %                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
0010 %                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
0011 %                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database
0012 %                       (opt, default 'RAVEN/external/kegg'). If
0013 %                       keggModel.mat is present in the same directory, the
0014 %                       function reads the data from this file and ignores
0015 %                       keggGenes.mat, keggMets.mat and keggRxns.mat
0016 %   keepSpontaneous     include reactions labeled as "spontaneous" (opt,
0017 %                       default true)
0018 %   keepUndefinedStoich include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
0019 %                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
0020 %                       (opt, default true)
0021 %   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
0022 %                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
0023 %                       default true)
0024 %   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
0025 %                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
0026 %                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
0027 %                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
0028 %                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
0029 %                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
0030 %                       such reactions (opt, default false)
0031 %
0032 %   Output:
0033 %   model               a model structure generated from the database. All
0034 %                       reactions and the metabolites used in them will be
0035 %                       added
0036 %   KOModel             a model structure representing the KEGG Orthology
0037 %                       ids and their associated genes. The KO ids are
0038 %                       saved as reactions
0039 %
0040 %   NOTE: The model output from getModelFromKEGG can be used as template
0041 %   for fillGaps. In that case, ensure that the genes and rxnGeneMat fields
0042 %   are removed before parsing: model=rmfield(model,'genes'), etc.
0043 %
0044 %   Usage: [model,KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(keggPath,keepSpontaneous,...
0045 %    keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral)
0046 
0047 if nargin<1
0048     keggPath='RAVEN/external/kegg';
0049 end
0050 if nargin<2
0051     keepSpontaneous=true;
0052 end
0053 if nargin<3
0054     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0055 end
0056 if nargin<4
0057     keepIncomplete=true;
0058 end
0059 if nargin<5
0060     keepGeneral=false;
0061 end
0062 
0063 ravenPath=findRAVENroot();
0064 modelFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggModel.mat');
0065 if exist(modelFile, 'file') && isNewestFile(ravenPath)
0066     fprintf(['Importing the global KEGG model from ' strrep(modelFile,'\','/') '... ']);
0067     load(modelFile);
0068     fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0069 else
0070     fprintf(['NOTE: The file ' strrep(modelFile,'\','/') ' does not exist or is out-of-date and therefore will be (re)generated\n']);
0071     %First get all reactions
0072     [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath);
0073     
0074     %Get the KO ids that are associated with any of the reactions. They
0075     %will be used later on to create a rxn-gene matrix
0076     KOs=cell(numel(model.rxns)*2,1);
0077     %Make room for two KO ids per reaction
0078     
0079     addToIndex=1;
0080     %Add all KO ids that are used
0081     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0082         if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0083             for j=1:numel(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name)
0084                 if strcmpi('kegg.orthology',model.rxnMiriams{i}.name{j})
0085                     %Add the KO id
0086                     KOs(addToIndex)=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(j);
0087                     addToIndex=addToIndex+1;
0088                 end
0089             end
0090         end
0091     end
0092     
0093     KOs=KOs(1:addToIndex-1);
0094     KOs=unique(KOs);
0095     
0096     %Get all genes from any organism in KEGG that is associated with any of
0097     %the KOs
0098     KOModel=getGenesFromKEGG(keggPath,KOs);
0099     
0100     fprintf('Pruning the global KEGG model from the partially annotated, lumped KEGG Orthology entries... ')
0101     model.genes=KOModel.genes;
0102     
0103     %It can be that there are KOs from the reactions that have no database
0104     %entry. These are (as far as I have seen) lumped versions of other KOs
0105     %and should be removed
0106     KOsToRemove=setdiff(KOs, KOModel.rxns);
0107     
0108     %Loop through all reactions and delete the KOs that were not found
0109     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0110         if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0111             for j=1:numel(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name)
0112                 toDel=[];
0113                 if strcmp(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name{j},'kegg.orthology')
0114                     if ismember(model.rxnMiriams{i}.value{j},KOsToRemove)
0115                         toDel=[toDel;j];
0116                     end
0117                 end
0118             end
0119             %Delete the KOs
0120             if any(toDel)
0121                 %If all posts are deleted, then delete the whole structure
0122                 if numel(toDel)==j
0123                     model.rxnMiriams{i}=[];
0124                 else
0125                     model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(toDel)=[];
0126                     model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(toDel)=[];
0127                 end
0128             end
0129         end
0130     end
0131     fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0132     
0133     fprintf('Constructing the rxnGeneMat for the global KEGG model...   0%% complete');
0134     %Create the rxnGeneMat for the reactions. This is simply done by
0135     %merging the gene associations for all the involved KOs
0136     r=zeros(10000000,1);
0137     %Store the positions since it's slow to write to a sparse array in a
0138     %loop
0139     c=zeros(10000000,1);
0140     counter=1;
0141     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0142         if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0143             I=strncmp('kegg.orthology',model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,18);
0144             if any(I)
0145                 [J, K]=ismember(model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I),KOModel.rxns);
0146                 %Find all gene indexes that correspond to any of these KOs
0147                 [~, L]=find(KOModel.rxnGeneMat(K(J),:));
0148                 if any(L)
0149                     %Allocate room for more elements if needed
0150                     if counter+numel(L)-1>=numel(r)
0151                         r=[r;zeros(numel(r),1)];
0152                         c=[c;zeros(numel(c),1)];
0153                     end
0154                     r(counter:counter+numel(L)-1)=ones(numel(L),1)*i;
0155                     c(counter:counter+numel(L)-1)=L(:);
0156                     counter=counter+numel(L);
0157                 end
0158             end
0159         end
0160         if rem(i-1,100) == 0
0161             progress=pad(num2str(floor(i/numel(model.rxns)*100)),3,'left');
0162             fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b%s%% complete',progress);
0163         end
0164     end
0165     
0166     model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(r(1:counter-1),c(1:counter-1),ones(counter-1,1));
0167     if size(model.rxnGeneMat,1)~=numel(model.rxns) || size(model.rxnGeneMat,2)~=numel(KOModel.genes)
0168         model.rxnGeneMat(numel(model.rxns),numel(KOModel.genes))=0;
0169     end
0170     fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\bCOMPLETE\n');
0171     
0172     %Then get all metabolites
0173     metModel=getMetsFromKEGG(keggPath);
0174     
0175     fprintf('Finalizing the global KEGG model... ');
0176     %Add information about all metabolites to the model
0177     [a, b]=ismember(model.mets,metModel.mets);
0178     a=find(a);
0179     b=b(a);
0180     
0181     if ~isfield(model,'metNames')
0182         model.metNames=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0183         model.metNames(:)={''};
0184     end
0185     model.metNames(a)=metModel.metNames(b);
0186     
0187     if ~isfield(model,'metFormulas')
0188         model.metFormulas=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0189         model.metFormulas(:)={''};
0190     end
0191     model.metFormulas(a)=metModel.metFormulas(b);
0192     
0193     if ~isfield(model,'inchis')
0194         model.inchis=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0195         model.inchis(:)={''};
0196     end
0197     model.inchis(a)=metModel.inchis(b);
0198     
0199     if ~isfield(model,'metMiriams')
0200         model.metMiriams=cell(numel(model.mets),1);
0201     end
0202     model.metMiriams(a)=metModel.metMiriams(b);
0203     
0204     %The composition should be loaded from InChIs when available
0205     I=find(~cellfun(@isempty,model.inchis));
0206     for i=1:numel(I)
0207         S=regexp(model.inchis(I(i)),'/','split');
0208         S=S{1};
0209         if numel(S)>=2
0210             %Don't copy if it doesn't look good
0211             model.metFormulas(I(i))=S(2);
0212         end
0213     end
0214     
0215     %Put all metabolites in one compartment called 's' (for system). This
0216     %is done just to be more compatible with the rest of the code
0217     model.comps={'s'};
0218     model.compNames={'System'};
0219     model.metComps=ones(numel(model.mets),1);
0220     
0221     %If reactions with undefined stoichiometry are kept, then the
0222     %corresponding metabolites will have ids such as "(n+1) C00001" and
0223     %their names will be empty. These ids are not valid SBML identifiers
0224     %and are therefore replaced with "undefined1, undefined2...". The
0225     %former ids are stored as the new names
0226     I=find(cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'n')) | cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'m')));
0227     model.metNames(I)=model.mets(I);
0228     repNums=1:numel(I);
0229     repIDs=strcat('undefined_',cellfun(@num2str,num2cell(repNums(:)),'UniformOutput',false));
0230     model.mets(I)=repIDs;
0231     
0232     %It could also be that the metabolite names are empty for some other
0233     %reason. In that case, use the ID instead
0234     I=cellfun(@isempty,model.metNames);
0235     model.metNames(I)=model.mets(I);
0236     
0237     %Save the model structure
0238     save(modelFile,'model','KOModel','isGeneral','isIncomplete','isUndefinedStoich','isSpontaneous');
0239     fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0240 end
0241 
0242 %Delete reactions which are labeled as "incomplete", "erroneous",
0243 %"unclear", "general reaction" or having undefined stoichiometry (depending
0244 %on settings)
0245 if keepSpontaneous==false
0246     model=removeReactions(model,intersect(isSpontaneous,model.rxns),true,true);
0247 end
0248 if keepUndefinedStoich==false
0249     model=removeReactions(model,intersect(isUndefinedStoich,model.rxns),true,true);
0250 end
0251 if keepIncomplete==false
0252     model=removeReactions(model,intersect(isIncomplete,model.rxns),true,true);
0253 end
0254 if keepGeneral==false
0255     model=removeReactions(model,intersect(isGeneral,model.rxns),true,true);
0256 end
0257 
0258 end
0259 
0260 function output = isNewestFile(ravenPath)
0261 %The ad hoc function, which checks whether keggModel.mat is the more
0262 %recently modified than keggRxns.mat, keggGenes.mat and keggRxns.mat
0263 modelFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggModel.mat');
0264 rxnsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat');
0265 genesFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggGenes.mat');
0266 metsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggMets.mat');
0267 if (getFileTime(modelFile)>getFileTime(rxnsFile))&&...
0268         (getFileTime(modelFile)>getFileTime(genesFile))&&...
0269         (getFileTime(modelFile)>getFileTime(metsFile))
0270     output=1;
0271 else
0272     output=0;
0273 end
0274 end
0275 
0276 function modTime = getFileTime(fileName)
0277 %Gets a last modification time for a particular file in datenum format that
0278 %the numbers could be easily compared for different files
0279 listing = dir(fileName);
0280 assert(numel(listing) == 1, 'No such file: %s', fileName);
0281 modTime = listing.datenum;
0282 format long;
0283 end
